 12	 quality: 85,
 13	 parallelConnections: 1
 14	 });
 15	 const [batches, setBatches] = useState<BatchJob[]>([]);
 16	 const [loading, setLoading] = useState(false);
 17	 const [error, setError] = useState<string | null>(null);
 18	 const [success, setSuccess] = useState<string | null>(null);
 19	
 20	 useEffect(() => {
 21	 loadBatches();
 22	 const interval = setInterval(loadBatches, 2000); // Refresh every 2 seconds
 23	 return () => clearInterval(interval);
 24	 }, []);
 25	
 26	 const loadBatches = async () => {
 27	 try {
 28	 const response = await imageApi.getAllBatches();
 29	 if (response.success && response.batches) {
 30	 setBatches(response.batches);
 31	 }
 32	 } catch (error) {
 33	 console.error('Failed to load batches:', error);
 34	 }
 35	 };
 36	
 37	 const validateFolderPath = (path: string): string | null => {
 38	 const trimmedPath = path.trim();
 39	
 40	 if (!trimmedPath) {
 41	 return 'Please enter a folder path';
 42	 }
 43	
 44	 // Basic path validation
 45	 if (trimmedPath.length < 2) {
 46	 return 'Path is too short';
 47	 }
 48	
 49	 // Check for invalid characters (basic validation)
 50	 const invalidChars = /[<>"|?*]/;
 51	 if (invalidChars.test(trimmedPath)) {
 52	 return 'Path contains invalid characters';
 53	 }
 54	
 55	 return null;
 56	 };
 57	
 58	 const handleStartBatch = async (e: React.FormEvent) => {
 59	 e.preventDefault();
 60	
 61	 const pathError = validateFolderPath(folderPath);
 62	 if (pathError) {
 63	 setError(pathError);
 64	 return;
 65	 }
 66	
 67	 setLoading(true);
 68	 setError(null);
 69	 setSuccess(null);
 70	
 71	 try {
 72	 console.log(`Starting batch processing for path: "${folderPath.trim()}"`);
 73	 const response = await imageApi.startBatchProcessing(folderPath.trim(), options);
 74	
 75	 if (response.success) {
 76	 setSuccess(`Batch processing started! Batch ID: ${response.batchId}`);
 77	 setFolderPath('');
 78	 loadBatches();
 79	 } else {
 80	 setError(response.error || 'Failed to start batch processing');
 81	 }
 82	 } catch (error: any) {
 83	 console.error('Batch processing error:', error);
 84	 const errorMessage = error.response?.data?.error || error.message || 'Failed to start batch processing';
 85	 setError(errorMessage);
 86	 } finally {
 87	 setLoading(false);
 88	 }
 89	 };
 90	
 91	 const handleDeleteBatch = async (batchId: string) => {
 92	 try {
 93	 const response = await imageApi.deleteBatch(batchId);
 94	 if (response.success) {
 95	 loadBatches();
 96	 } else {
 97	 setError(response.error || 'Failed to delete batch');
 98	 }
 99	 } catch (error: any) {
 100	 setError(error.response?.data?.error || error.message || 'Failed to delete batch');
 101	 }
 102	 };
 103	
 104	 const getStatusIcon = (status: string) => {
 105	 switch (status) {
 106	 case 'processing': return '⏳';
 107	 case 'completed': return '✅';
 108	 case 'error': return '❌';
 109	 default: return '';
 110	 }
 111	 };
 112	
 113	 const getStatusColor = (status: string) => {
 114	 switch (status) {
 115	 case 'processing': return '#ffc107';
 116	 case 'completed': return '#28a745';
 117	 case 'error': return '#dc3545';
 118	 default: return '#6c757d';
 119	 }
 120	 };
 121	
 122	 const formatDuration = (startTime: string, endTime?: string) => {
 123	 const start = new Date(startTime);
 124	 const end = endTime ? new Date(endTime) : new Date();
 125	 const duration = Math.round((end.getTime() - start.getTime()) / 1000);
 126	 
 127	 if (duration < 60) return `${duration}s`;
 128	 if (duration < 3600) return `${Math.floor(duration / 60)}m ${duration % 60}s`;
 129	 return `${Math.floor(duration / 3600)}h ${Math.floor((duration % 3600) / 60)}m`;
 130	 };
 131	
 132	 return (
 133	 <div className="batch-container">
 134	 <div className="batch-header">
 135	 <Link to="/" className="back-link">
 136	 ← Back to Gallery
 137	 </Link>
 138	 <h1>Batch Processing</h1>
 139	 <p>Process multiple images from a folder recursively</p>
 140	 </div>
 141	
 142	 <div className="batch-form-section">
 143	 <h2>Start New Batch</h2>
 144	 <form onSubmit={handleStartBatch} className="batch-form">
 145	 <div className="form-group">
 146	 <label htmlFor="folderPath">Folder Path</label>
 147	 <input
 148	 id="folderPath"
 149	 type="text"
 150	 value={folderPath}
 151	 onChange={(e) => setFolderPath(e.target.value)}
 152	 placeholder="/path/to/your/images/folder"
 153	 className="folder-input"
 154	 disabled={loading}
 155	 />
 156	 <small className="help-text">
 157	 Enter the full path to the folder containing images. All subfolders will be processed recursively.
 158	 <br />
 159	 <strong>Note:</strong> Paths with spaces are supported (e.g., "/Users/john/My Photos/Vacation 2024").
 160	 <br />
 161	 <strong>Examples:</strong>
 162	 <br />
 163	 • macOS/Linux: <code>/Users/username/Pictures/My Photos</code>
 164	 <br />
 165	 • Windows: <code>C:\Users\username\Pictures\My Photos</code>
 166	 </small>
 167	 </div>
 168	
 169	 <div className="options-grid">
 170	 <div className="form-group">
 171	 <label htmlFor="thumbnailSize">Thumbnail Size</label>
 172	 <input
 173	 id="thumbnailSize"
 174	 type="number"
 175	 value={options.thumbnailSize}
 176	 onChange={(e) => setOptions({...options, thumbnailSize: parseInt(e.target.value)})}
 177	 min="100"
 178	 max="800"
 179	 disabled={loading}
 180	 />
 181	 </div>
 182	
 183	 <div className="form-group">
 184	 <label htmlFor="geminiImageSize">AI Analysis Size</label>
 185	 <input
 186	 id="geminiImageSize"
 187	 type="number"
 188	 value={options.geminiImageSize}
 189	 onChange={(e) => setOptions({...options, geminiImageSize: parseInt(e.target.value)})}
 190	 min="512"
 191	 max="2048"
 192	 disabled={loading}
 193	 />
 194	 </div>
 195	
 196	 <div className="form-group">
 197	 <label htmlFor="quality">JPEG Quality</label>
 198	 <input
 199	 id="quality"
 200	 type="number"
 201	 value={options.quality}
 202	 onChange={(e) => setOptions({...options, quality: parseInt(e.target.value)})}
 203	 min="50"
 204	 max="100"
 205	 disabled={loading}
 206	 />
 207	 </div>
 208	
 209	 <div className="form-group">
 210	 <label htmlFor="parallelConnections">
 211	 Parallel Gemini Connections: {options.parallelConnections}
 212	 </label>
 213	 <input
 214	 id="parallelConnections"
 215	 type="range"
 216	 min="1"
 217	 max="10"
 218	 value={options.parallelConnections}
 219	 onChange={(e) => setOptions({...options, parallelConnections: parseInt(e.target.value)})}
 220	 disabled={loading}
 221	 className="slider"
 222	 />
 223	 <div className="slider-labels">
 224	 <span>1 (Sequential)</span>
 225	 <span>10 (Max Parallel)</span>
 226	 </div>
 227	 <small className="help-text">
 228	 Higher values process images faster but may hit API rate limits.
 229	 Start with 1 for reliability, increase gradually if needed.
 230	 </small>
 231	 </div>
 232	
 233	 <div className="form-group checkbox-group">
 234	 <label className="checkbox-label">
 235	 <input
 236	 type="checkbox"
 237	 checked={options.skipDuplicates}
 238	 onChange={(e) => setOptions({...options, skipDuplicates: e.target.checked})}
 239	 disabled={loading}
 240	 />
 241	 Skip duplicate files
 242	 </label>
 243	 </div>
 244	 </div>
 245	
 246	 <button
 247	 type="submit"
 248	 className="start-batch-button"
 249	 disabled={loading || !folderPath.trim()}
 250	 >
 251	 {loading ? 'Starting...' : 'Start Batch Processing'}
 252	 </button>
 253	 </form>
 254	
 255	 {error && (
 256	 <div className="message error">
 257	 <span className="icon">❌</span>
 258	 <p>{error}</p>
 259	 </div>
 260	 )}
 261	
 262	 {success && (
 263	 <div className="message success">
 264	 <span className="icon">✅</span>
 265	 <p>{success}</p>
 266	 </div>
 267	 )}
 268	 </div>
 269	
 270	 <div className="batches-section">
 271	 <h2>Batch History</h2>
 272	 
 273	 {batches.length === 0 ? (
 274	 <div className="no-batches">
 275	 <div className="no-batches-icon"></div>
 276	 <h3>No batch jobs found</h3>
 277	 <p>Start your first batch processing job above</p>
 278	 </div>
 279	 ) : (
 280	 <div className="batches-list">
 281	 {batches.map((batch) => (
 282	 <div key={batch.id} className="batch-card">
 283	 <div className="batch-header-row">
 284	 <div className="batch-info">
 285	 <h3 className="batch-title">
 286	 <span 
 287	 className="status-icon"
 288	 style={{ color: getStatusColor(batch.result.status) }}
 289	 >
 290	 {getStatusIcon(batch.result.status)}
 291	 </span>
 292	 {batch.folderPath}
 293	 </h3>
 294	 <p className="batch-meta">
 295	 Started: {new Date(batch.createdAt).toLocaleString()} • 
 296	 Duration: {formatDuration(batch.result.startTime, batch.result.endTime)}
 297	 </p>
 298	 </div>
 299	 
 300	 <div className="batch-actions">
 301	 {(batch.result.status === 'completed' || batch.result.status === 'error') && (
 302	 <button
 303	 onClick={() => handleDeleteBatch(batch.id)}
 304	 className="delete-button"
 305	 title="Delete batch"
 306	 >
 307	 ️
 308	 </button>
 309	 )}
 310	 </div>
 311	 </div>
 312	
 313	 <div className="batch-progress">
 314	 <div className="progress-stats">
 315	 <div className="stat">
 316	 <span className="stat-label">Total:</span>
 317	 <span className="stat-value">{batch.result.totalFiles}</span>
 318	 </div>
 319	 <div className="stat">
 320	 <span className="stat-label">Processed:</span>
 321	 <span className="stat-value">{batch.result.processedFiles}</span>
 322	 </div>
 323	 <div className="stat success">
 324	 <span className="stat-label">Success:</span>
 325	 <span className="stat-value">{batch.result.successfulFiles}</span>
 326	 </div>
 327	 <div className="stat warning">
 328	 <span className="stat-label">Duplicates:</span>
 329	 <span className="stat-value">{batch.result.duplicateFiles}</span>
 330	 </div>
 331	 <div className="stat error">
 332	 <span className="stat-label">Errors:</span>
 333	 <span className="stat-value">{batch.result.errorFiles}</span>
 334	 </div>
 335	 </div>
 336	
 337	 {batch.result.totalFiles > 0 && (
 338	 <div className="progress-bar">
 339	 <div 
 340	 className="progress-fill"
 341	 style={{ 
 342	 width: `${(batch.result.processedFiles / batch.result.totalFiles) * 100}%`,
 343	 backgroundColor: getStatusColor(batch.result.status)
 344	 }}
 345	 ></div>
 346	 </div>
 347	 )}
 348	 </div>
 349	
 350	 {batch.result.errors.length > 0 && (
 351	 <details className="batch-errors">
 352	 <summary>View Errors ({batch.result.errors.length})</summary>
 353	 <div className="errors-list">
 354	 {batch.result.errors.map((error, index) => (
 355	 <div key={index} className="error-item">
 356	 <span className="error-type">[{error.type}]</span>
 357	 <span className="error-file">{error.file}</span>
 358	 <span className="error-message">{error.error}</span>
 359	 </div>
 360	 ))}
 361	 </div>
 362	 </details>
 363	 )}
 364	 </div>
 365	 ))}
 366	 </div>
 367	 )}
 368	 </div>
 369	 </div>
 370	 );
 371	};
 372	
 373	export default BatchProcessing;

 1	# Image Tagger - Development Scripts
 2	
 3	This directory contains helpful scripts to manage the Image Tagger application development environment.
 4	
 5	## Quick Start
 6	
 7	### First Time Setup
 8	```bash
 9	# Make scripts executable (Unix/Mac/Linux)
 10	chmod +x scripts/*.sh
 11	
 12	# Run setup script
 13	./scripts/setup.sh
 14	```
 15	
 16	### Start the Application
 17	```bash
 18	# Unix/Mac/Linux
 19	./scripts/start.sh
 20	
 21	# Windows
 22	scripts\start.bat
 23	```
 24	
 25	### Stop the Application
 26	```bash
 27	# Unix/Mac/Linux
 28	./scripts/stop.sh
 29	
 30	# Windows
 31	scripts\stop.bat
 32	```
 33	
 34	## Available Scripts
 35	
 36	### Setup Scripts
 37	
 38	#### `setup.sh` / `setup.bat`
 39	- **Purpose**: Initial project setup
 40	- **What it does**:
 41	 - Checks Node.js installation
 42	 - Installs all dependencies (server + client)
 43	 - Creates `.env` file from template
 44	 - Creates necessary directories
 45	 - Builds the project
 46	 - Makes scripts executable
 47	
 48	#### `start.sh` / `start.bat`
 49	- **Purpose**: Start both server and client
 50	- **What it does**:
 51	 - Checks for dependencies
 52	 - Starts server on port 3001
 53	 - Starts client on port 5173
 54	 - Runs both concurrently with colored output
 55	
 56	#### `stop.sh` / `stop.bat`
 57	- **Purpose**: Stop all running processes
 58	- **What it does**:
 59	 - Kills server processes (nodemon, ts-node)
 60	 - Kills client processes (vite)
 61	 - Frees up ports 3001 and 5173
 62	 - Force kills if graceful shutdown fails
 63	
 64	## NPM Scripts
 65	
 66	The following scripts are available via `npm run`:
 67	
 68	### Development Scripts
 69	```bash
 70	npm run dev # Start server only (same as dev:server)
 71	npm run dev:server # Start server only
 72	npm run dev:client # Start client only
 73	npm run dev:both # Start both server and client concurrently
 74	```
 75	
 76	### Build Scripts
 77	```bash
 78	npm run build # Build server only
 79	npm run build:all # Build both server and client
 80	```
 81	
 82	### Installation Scripts
 83	```bash
 84	npm run install:all # Install dependencies for both server and client
 85	```
 86	
 87	### Utility Scripts
 88	```bash
 89	npm run stop # Stop all processes (Unix/Linux/Mac only)
 90	```
 91	
 92	## Manual Commands
 93	
 94	If you prefer to run commands manually:
 95	
 96	### Server
 97	```bash
 98	# Development mode with hot reload
 99	npm run dev
 100	
 101	# Production mode
 102	npm run build
 103	npm start
 104	```
 105	
 106	### Client
 107	```bash
 108	cd client
 109	
 110	# Development mode
 111	npm run dev
 112	
 113	# Build for production
 114	npm run build
 115	```
 116	
 117	## Environment Variables
 118	
 119	Make sure to set up your `.env` file with the following variables:
 120	
 121	```env
 122	# Required
 123	GEMINI_API_KEY=your_gemini_api_key_here
 124	
 125	# Optional (with defaults)
 126	PORT=3001
 127	NODE_ENV=development
 128	MAX_FILE_SIZE=52428800
 129	UPLOAD_DIR=./uploads
 130	THUMBNAIL_DIR=./thumbnails
 131	THUMBNAIL_SIZE=300
 132	GEMINI_IMAGE_SIZE=1024
 133	DATABASE_PATH=./database.sqlite
 134	```
 135	
 136	## Troubleshooting
 137	
 138	### Port Already in Use
 139	If you get "port already in use" errors:
 140	```bash
 141	# Check what's using the ports
 142	lsof -i :3001 # Server port
 143	lsof -i :5173 # Client port
 144	
 145	# Kill processes manually
 146	kill -9 <PID>
 147	
 148	# Or use the stop script
 149	./scripts/stop.sh
 150	```
 151	
 152	### Permission Denied (Unix/Linux/Mac)
 153	```bash
 154	# Make scripts executable
 155	chmod +x scripts/*.sh
 156	```
 157	
 158	### Dependencies Issues
 159	```bash
 160	# Clean install
 161	rm -rf node_modules client/node_modules
 162	npm run install:all
 163	```
 164	
 165	### Build Issues
 166	```bash
 167	# Clean build
 168	rm -rf dist client/dist
 169	npm run build:all
 170	```
 171	
 172	## Platform Support
 173	
 174	- **Unix/Linux/Mac**: Use `.sh` scripts
 175	- **Windows**: Use `.bat` scripts
 176	- **Cross-platform**: Use `npm run` commands
 177	
 178	## Useful URLs
 179	
 180	When running in development mode:
 181	- **Client**: http://localhost:5173
 182	- **Server API**: http://localhost:3001/api
 183	- **Health Check**: http://localhost:3001/api/health
 184	
 185	## Additional Resources
 186	
 187	- [Node.js Installation](https://nodejs.org/)
 188	- [Gemini API Key](https://makersuite.google.com/app/apikey)
 189	- [Project README](../README.md)
 190

 10	## Expanding the ESLint configuration
 11	
 12	If you are developing a production application, we recommend updating the configuration to enable type-aware lint rules:
 13	
 14	```js
 15	export default tseslint.config([
 16	 globalIgnores(['dist']),
 17	 {
 18	 files: ['**/*.{ts,tsx}'],
 19	 extends: [
 20	 // Other configs...
 21	
 22	 // Remove tseslint.configs.recommended and replace with this
 23	 ...tseslint.configs.recommendedTypeChecked,
 24	 // Alternatively, use this for stricter rules
 25	 ...tseslint.configs.strictTypeChecked,
 26	 // Optionally, add this for stylistic rules
 27	 ...tseslint.configs.stylisticTypeChecked,
 28	
 29	 // Other configs...
 30	 ],
 31	 languageOptions: {
 32	 parserOptions: {
 33	 project: ['./tsconfig.node.json', './tsconfig.app.json'],
 34	 tsconfigRootDir: import.meta.dirname,
 35	 },
 36	 // other options...
 37	 },
 38	 },
 39	])
 40	```
 41	
 42	You can also install [eslint-plugin-react-x](https://github.com/Rel1cx/eslint-react/tree/main/packages/plugins/eslint-plugin-react-x) and [eslint-plugin-react-dom](https://github.com/Rel1cx/eslint-react/tree/main/packages/plugins/eslint-plugin-react-dom) for React-specific lint rules:
 43	
 44	```js
 45	// eslint.config.js
 46	import reactX from 'eslint-plugin-react-x'
 47	import reactDom from 'eslint-plugin-react-dom'
 48	
 49	export default tseslint.config([
 50	 globalIgnores(['dist']),
 51	 {
 52	 files: ['**/*.{ts,tsx}'],
 53	 extends: [
 54	 // Other configs...
 55	 // Enable lint rules for React

 57	 // Enable lint rules for React DOM

 63	 tsconfigRootDir: import.meta.dirname,
 64	 },
 65	 // other options...
 66	 },
 67	 },
 68	])
 69	```
